text: Lllewellyn Charles Nash (23 July 1868 – 14 October 1918), also known as L.C. Nash, was an Irish rugby union player who played in the forward position. He was capped six times for Ireland.The Quest Goes On, Being a Short History of the First Hundred Years of St John's School, Leatherhead, by E.M.P. Williams. Published Leatherhead, 1951, p.50 ==Life== Lllewellyn Charles Nash was born on 23 July 1868 in Kinsale, Ireland. He was educated at St John's School, Leatherhead and Queen's College Cork. Nash made his test debut for Ireland against Scotland at Belfast on 16 February 1889. Nash’s final game for Ireland was against Wales at Llanelli on 7 March 1891. In total, Nash was capped six times for Ireland with Ireland winning five out of six of those games. Nash died in Swansea, Wales, on 14 October 1918. ==References== Category:1868 births Category:1918 deaths Category:Ireland international rugby union players Category:People educated at St John's School, Leatherhead
title: L.C. Nash
